title: Problem-Solving Project Through Geometric Construction and Reasoning

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary geometric concepts (line segments, angles, parallel/perpendicular relationships) and experience with dynamic geometry environments (DGE) like GeoGebra
context.additional_context: Utilization of construction tools implementable in smartphone-centric environments, emphasizing conceptual inquiry through problem-solving rather than step-by-step explanations

learning_goals: Students can solve geometric construction problems applying at least three geometric conditions (congruence, perpendicularity, parallelism, angle bisecting) with 90% accuracy.
Learners can derive at least three inferential conclusions based on invariants observed (e.g., properties of circles) after manipulating shapes in a dynamic geometry environment.
Through team-based project deliverables, learners can describe the logical relationships of geometric concepts at or above van Hiele Level 3.

resources: Collaborative Whiteboard Space for Group Learning
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
